raw_comment:
1. Age
- I wonder why they chose that
- Very well
- Increasing
2. I wonder why Indonesia’s results are so high and why Brazil and Mali's results are so low. I wonder if their location impacted their results. I also wonder if these results will change in the future or how these results would have compared to the past. 
3. This is an interesting counterpoint to many discourses around generational attitudes: especially the notion that GenZ is somehow more 'cynical', and also the evidence that the younger generation has a much worse time than the baby boomers when it comes to job security and home ownership prospects.
4. In this graph, we see a graph that displays how different aged people think whether or not the world is getting better with each generation. A catchy headline that captures the graph’s main idea would be “Will younger generations help make the world a better place in the future?”
ace_sentences: The graph uses age as a variable.
I wonder why the authors chose age as a variable.
The graph is very good.
The values in the graph increase.
Indonesia has a very high result.
Brazil has a very low result.
Mali has a very low result.
I wonder why Indonesia has a high result.
I wonder why Brazil has a low result.
I wonder why Mali has a low result.
Indonesia has a location.
Brazil has a location.
Mali has a location.
I wonder whether the location of Indonesia impacted the result of Indonesia.
I wonder whether the location of Brazil impacted the result of Brazil.
I wonder whether the location of Mali impacted the result of Mali.
I wonder whether these results will change in the future.
I wonder how these results compare to results in the past.
Many discourses exist about generational attitudes.
Some people say that GenZ is more cynical.
This graph is a counterpoint to this notion.
Some evidence says that the younger generation has worse job security than the baby boomers.
Some evidence says that the younger generation has worse home ownership prospects than the baby boomers.
The graph displays opinions of people of different ages.
The opinions are about whether the world is getting better with each generation.
The headline is: Will younger generations help make the world a better place in the future?
